ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Polar TIMAS H2 Level 1 Ion Upflowing Fluxes Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, metadata versioned up to SPASE 2.6.0, reviewed by LFB 20230727

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: H+, O+, He+ and He++ upflowing fluxes and statistical uncertainties processed by the TIMAS science team.These data were used in preparing several papers, see Information URLs. Includes also non-TIMAS Data: UT, altitude, invariant latitude, L shell, magnetic local time, geomagnetic latitude (signed - n/s hemisphere), average magnetic field vector in GSM coordinates at Polar (uses KH's co-ord conversion code), spacecraft potential from EFI data base, solar zenith angles at each end of the field line, time delayed solar wind parameters from WIND (Using KH's database) interpolated across data gaps of less than 10 minutes, IMF in GSM, solar wind dynamic pressure (nPa), solar wind density (/cc), solar wind velocity (km/sec). This is a summary data base.It does not contain detailed energy step and pitch angle information for each data point. Extends over all altitudes, invariant latitudes and MLT. Below altitude of 4.0 Re 2 spin resolution (12s), above altitude of 4.0 Re 4 spin resolution (24s). Reference:E.G. Shelley et al., The Toroidal Imaging Mass-Angle Spectrograph (TIMAS) for the Polar Mission, Sp. Sci. Rev, Vol 71, pp 497-530, 1995.

InformationURL.Description: Solar-minimum quiet-time ion energization and outflow in dynamic boundary related coordinates, W.K. Peterson, L. Andersson, B.C. Callahan, H.L. Collin, J.D. Scudder, and A.W. Yau, To appear in J. Geophys. Res., 2008.

InformationURL.Name: Peterson et al., JGR 2006
InformationURL.Description: Quiet time solar illumination effects on the fluxes and characteristic energies of ionospheric outflow, W.K. Peterson, H.L. Collin, O.W. Lennartsson and A.W. Yau, J. Geophys. Res., 111, A11S05, doi:10.1029/2005JA011596, 2006.

InformationURL.Name: Lennartson et al. JGR, 2004
InformationURL.Description: Solar wind control of Earth's H+ and O+ outflow rates in the 15-eV to 33-keV energy range, O.W Lennartsson, W.K. Peterson, and H.L. Collin, J. Geophys. Res., Vol. 109, No. A12, A12212 10.1029/2004JA010690, 15 December 2004.

InformationURL.Name: Peterson et al., JGR, 2001

InformationURL.Name: Collin et al., GRL, 1998

NumericalData.Caveats: Several compromises were made in assembling the data base. In particular background subtraction, short averaging intervals and the normally low count rates for minor ions (O+, He+, and He++) lead to many data intervals where the data values reported are not statistically significant. The data files therefore contain many diagnostic parameters and data quality flags.

Parameter.Name: Center Epoch for H_Fluence
Parameter.Description: NSSDC standard-reference time value at the center of the accumulation interval.
Parameter.Caveats: Center epoch (milliseconds since 0 AD of variable accumulation intervals for H+

Parameter.Name: Center Epoch for O_Fluence
Parameter.Description: NSSDC standard-reference time value at the center of the accumulation interval.
Parameter.Caveats: Center epoch (milliseconds since 0 AD of variable accumulation intervals for O+

Parameter.Name: Center Epoch for He1_Fluence
Parameter.Description: NSSDC standard-reference time value at the center of the accumulation interval.
Parameter.Caveats: Center epoch (milliseconds since 0 AD of variable accumulation intervals for He+

Parameter.Name: Center Epoch for He2_Fluence
Parameter.Description: NSSDC standard-reference time value at the center of the accumulation interval.
Parameter.Caveats: Center epoch (milliseconds since 0 AD of variable accumulation intervals for He++

Parameter.Name: H+ Fluence
Parameter.Description: H+ Fluence (upward directed flux) at the altitude measured (R) with loss cone correction.
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude! Negative flux values correspond to downflowing fluxes.

Parameter.Name: O+ Fluence
Parameter.Description: O+ Fluence (upward directed flux) at the altitude measured (R) with loss cone correction.
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude! Negative flux values correspond to downflowing fluxes.

Parameter.Name: He+ Fluence
Parameter.Description: He+ Fluence (upward directed flux) at the altitude measured (R) with loss cone correction.
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude! Negative flux values correspond to downflowing fluxes.

Parameter.Name: He++ Fluence
Parameter.Description: He++ Fluence (upward directed flux) at the altitude measured (R) with loss cone correction.
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude! Negative flux values correspond to downflowing fluxes.

Parameter.Name: H+ 1 Sigma Fluence
Parameter.Description: One standard deviation (sigma) of H+ fluence at the altitude measured (R)
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Name: O+ 1 Sigma Fluence
Parameter.Description: One standard deviation (sigma) of O+ fluence at the altitude measured (R)
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Name: He+ 1 Sigma Fluence
Parameter.Description: One standard deviation (sigma) of O+ fluence at the altitude measured (R)
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Name: He++ 1 Sigma Fluence
Parameter.Description: One standard deviation (sigma) of He++ fluence at the altitude measured (R)
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Description: Net He+ energy flux at the altitude measured (R)
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Name: He++ E_Flux
Parameter.Description: Net He++ energy flux at the altitude measured (R)
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Name: H+ 1 Sigma E-Flux
Parameter.Description: One standard deviation (sigma) of H+ energy flux at the altitude measured (R)
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Name: O+ 1 Sigma E-Flux
Parameter.Description: One standard deviation (sigma) of O+ energy flux at the altitude measured (R)
Parameter.Caveats: For statistical studies normalize to a standard altitude!

Parameter.Name: He+ 1 Sigma E-Flux
Parameter.Description: One standard deviation (sigma) of He+ energy flux at the altitude measured (R)

Parameter.Name: Spins Accumulatated for H+ values
Parameter.Description: Number of spins accumulated for H+
Parameter.Caveats: Number of spins of data accumulated for H+.

Parameter.Name: Spins Accumulatated for O+ values
Parameter.Description: Number of spins accumulated for O+
Parameter.Caveats: Number of spins of data accumulated for O+.

Parameter.Name: Spins Accumulatated for He+ values
Parameter.Description: Number of spins accumulated for He+
Parameter.Caveats: Number of spins of data accumulated for He+.

Parameter.Name: Spins Accumulatated for He++ values
Parameter.Description: Number of spins accumulated for He++

Parameter.Name: SZA
Parameter.Description: Solar Zenith angle at the magnetic foot point
Parameter.Caveats: Check the SZA_status flag

Parameter.Name: Conjugate SZA
Parameter.Description: Solar Zenith angle at the Conjugate magnetic foot point
Parameter.Caveats: Check the Conjugate_SZA_status flag

Parameter.Name: SZA Status
Parameter.Description: Quality of the solar zenith angle (SZA) values: 0=good, 99=invalid

Parameter.Name: Conjugate SZA Status
Parameter.Description: Quality of the conjugate solar zenith angle (SZA) values: 0=good, 99=invalid

Parameter.Name: H+ Quality Flag
Parameter.Description: A quality flag in the range 0-99 with the following values/meanings: 0 OK. 1 Some data missing. 2 more than 5% data missing 3 not used. 4 not used. 5 Warning flags set. 6 not used. 9 Invalid pitch angles 99 No valid data.

Parameter.Name: O+ Quality Flag
Parameter.Description: A quality flag in the range 0-99 with the following values/meanings: 0 OK. 1 Some data missing. 2 more than 5% data missing 3 not used. 4 not used. 5 Warning flags set. 6 not used. 9 Invalid pitch angles 99 No valid data.

Parameter.Name: He+ Quality Flag
Parameter.Description: A quality flag in the range 0-99 with the following values/meanings: 0 OK. 1 Some data missing. 2 more than 5% data missing 3 not used. 4 not used. 5 Warning flags set. 6 not used. 9 Invalid pitch angles 99 No valid data.

Parameter.Name: He++ Quality Flag
Parameter.Description: A quality flag in the range 0-99 with the following values/meanings: 0 OK. 1 Some data missing. 2 more than 5% data missing 3 not used. 4 not used. 5 Warning flags set. 6 not used. 9 Invalid pitch angles 99 No valid data.

Parameter.Name: Geocentric Distance
Parameter.Description: Geocentric Distance

Parameter.Name: L parameter
Parameter.Description: MacIlwain L Parameter

Parameter.Name: MLT
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Local Time

Parameter.Name: LT
Parameter.Description: Local Time

Parameter.Name: Mlat
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Latitude

Parameter.Name: INVL
Parameter.Description: Invariant Latitude

Parameter.Name: B
Parameter.Description: Average magnetic field vector in GSM coordinates at Polar (Uses KH's co-ord conversion code).
Parameter.Caveats: 3 components are GSM -X, -Y, and -Z

Parameter.Name: SC Potential
Parameter.Description: Space craft potential from EFI
Parameter.Caveats: This Variable has not been extensively validated ... use with caution.

Parameter.Name: IMF
Parameter.Description: Time delayed Wind IMF Magnetic Field from WIND spacecraft in GSM Coordinates

Parameter.Name: SW Pressure
Parameter.Description: Time lagged solar wind dynamic pressure from WIND observations

Parameter.Name: SW density
Parameter.Description: Time lagged solar wind density from WIND observations

Parameter.Name: V
Parameter.Description: Time lagged Solar wind velocity from WIND in GSM Coordinates

Parameter.Name: FEC counts
Parameter.Description: Average counts per spin in the fast event counter
Parameter.Caveats: The TIMAS detector has a non linear response at high count rates that is, to some extent corrected for in the software that generated the data here. The correction, however introduces some uncertainty. The FEC count rate is carried as an indication of the corrections applied to the raw data.

Parameter.Name: Background counts
Parameter.Description: Average background counts per spin

Parameter.Name: Energy Range
Parameter.Description: TIMAS is operated in one of 3 energy ranges. Energy_Range ID indicates which of the 3 instrumental energy ranges is currently active. Energy Range Identification: 0: Full energy range; 1: Reduced energy range; 2: Low energy range

Parameter.Name: Hzero Intervals
Parameter.Description: # of intervals in the po_H0_tim data file included in the average reported here. These values should be compared with X_spins where = H, O He1 and He2

Parameter.Name: SCPot Status
Parameter.Description: Quality of the SC potential value obtained from EFI: 0=good 99=invalid

Parameter.Name: IMF_status
Parameter.Description: Quality of the IMF_status values: 0=good 99=invalid

Parameter.Name: SW Status
Parameter.Description: Quality of the SW data: 0=good 99=invalid

Parameter.Name: Mag Status
Parameter.Description: Quality of the Polar magnetometer data: 0=good 99=invalid

Parameter.Name: Orbit Status
Parameter.Description: Quality of the Polar ephemeris data: 0=good 99=invalid
